recipes.name: Classic French Toast
recipes.instructions:
1. Whisk eggs, milk, cream, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt in a shallow dish until smooth.
2. Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat and melt a pat of butter.
3. Dip each brioche slice into the custard, letting it soak 20-30 seconds per side.
4. Cook on the griddle 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through.
5. Serve immediately with butter, maple syrup, and fresh berries.

recipes.name: Shakshuka
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium heat. Add onion and pepper, cook 5 minutes until softened.
2. Add garlic, cumin, paprika, and cayenne. Cook 1 minute until fragrant.
3. Pour in crushed tomatoes, season with salt and pepper. Simmer 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
4. Make 6 wells in the sauce with a spoon. Crack an egg into each well.
5. Cover and cook 5-8 minutes until egg whites are set but yolks are still runny.
6. Garnish with cilantro and serve with crusty bread for dipping.

recipes.name: Buttermilk Pancakes
recipes.instructions:
1. Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk buttermilk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla.
3. Pour wet ingredients into dry and stir until just combined. Lumps are fine â€” do not overmix.
4. Heat a griddle to 350F or medium heat. Lightly butter the surface.
5. Pour 1/3 cup batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form on surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
6. Flip and cook 1-2 minutes more until golden. Serve with butter and syrup.

recipes.name: Eggs Benedict
recipes.instructions:
1. For hollandaise: Blend egg yolks and lemon juice 5 seconds. With blender running, slowly drizzle in hot melted butter until thick. Season with cayenne and salt.
2. Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer. Add vinegar. Swirl water and crack eggs in one at a time. Poach 3-4 minutes until whites are set.
3. Toast English muffins and warm Canadian bacon in a skillet.
4. Assemble: muffin half, bacon, poached egg, generous spoon of hollandaise.
5. Sprinkle with a pinch of cayenne and chives. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Loaded Breakfast Burrito
recipes.instructions:
1. Brown sausage in a skillet over medium-high heat, breaking into crumbles. Remove and set aside.
2. Whisk eggs with salt and pepper. Melt butter in the same skillet over medium-low heat. Pour in eggs and gently stir with a spatula, forming large soft curds. Remove when still slightly wet.
3. Warm tortillas on a dry skillet or in microwave 15 seconds.
4. Build each burrito: line of cheese down the center, scrambled eggs, sausage, black beans, salsa, and avocado.
5. Fold bottom up, then sides in, and roll tightly. Optional: sear seam-side down on a hot skillet for a crispy exterior.

recipes.name: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
recipes.instructions:
1. Toast sourdough until golden and crisp.
2. Bring water to a gentle simmer, add a splash of vinegar. Swirl and poach eggs 3 minutes.
3. Halve avocados and scoop onto toast. Smash with a fork, leaving it slightly chunky. Squeeze lemon juice on top.
4. Place poached egg on top of each toast. Season with flaky salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes.
5. Finish with a drizzle of good olive oil.

recipes.name: Smoked Salmon Bagel
recipes.instructions:
1. Slice and toast bagels until golden.
2. Spread a generous layer of cream cheese on each half.
3. Drape smoked salmon over the cream cheese.
4. Top with capers, thin rings of red onion, and fresh dill.
5. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the top and finish with cracked pepper.

recipes.name: Corned Beef Hash
recipes.instructions:
1. Par-boil diced potatoes in salted water 5 minutes until barely tender. Drain well.
2. Melt butter in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes in a single layer and cook without stirring 5 minutes until crispy on the bottom.
3. Add onion and cook 3 minutes. Add garlic, corned beef, paprika, and Worcestershire. Stir and press flat.
4. Cook without stirring another 5 minutes to form a crust. Flip sections and repeat.
5. Make 4 wells, crack eggs into them. Cover and cook 3-4 minutes until eggs are set.
6. Garnish with parsley and serve.

recipes.name: Belgian Waffles
recipes.instructions:
1. Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
2. In another bowl, whisk egg yolks, milk, melted butter, and vanilla.
3. Beat egg whites to stiff peaks with a hand mixer.
4. Pour wet ingredients into dry and stir until just combined. Gently fold in egg whites.
5. Preheat waffle iron. Cook waffles according to manufacturer's directions until deep golden and crispy.
6. Serve with whipped cream and fresh strawberries.

recipes.name: Huevos Rancheros
recipes.instructions:
1. Simmer tomatoes, chipotle, garlic, and onion in a saucepan 10 minutes. Season with salt.
2. Warm black beans in a small pot.
3. Fry tortillas in a little oil until slightly crispy, about 30 seconds per side. Drain on paper towels.
4. Fry eggs sunny-side up in the same skillet.
5. Layer: two tortillas per plate, spoon of beans, two eggs, ladle of salsa.
6. Top with crumbled cotija, avocado slices, and cilantro.

recipes.name: Croque Madame
recipes.instructions:
1. Make bechamel: melt 2 tbsp butter over medium heat, whisk in flour, cook 1 minute. Slowly whisk in milk. Cook until thick, 3-4 minutes. Stir in half the Gruyere, mustard, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
2. Spread bechamel on all bread slices. Layer ham and more cheese on 4 slices. Top with remaining slices.
3. Melt remaining butter in a skillet. Toast sandwiches 2-3 minutes per side until golden.
4. Top each sandwich with remaining Gruyere, broil 1-2 minutes until bubbly.
5. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Place one egg on top of each sandwich and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Brown Sugar Steel-Cut Oatmeal
recipes.instructions:
1. Bring water to a boil in a heavy saucepan. Stir in oats and salt.
2. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 25-30 minutes until oats are tender and creamy.
3. Stir in milk, brown sugar, cinnamon, and butter. Cook 2 more minutes.
4. Serve topped with toasted pecans, fresh blueberries, and an extra drizzle of brown sugar.

recipes.name: Smash Burgers
recipes.instructions:
1. Divide beef into 8 equal balls (about 2 oz each). Do not season yet.
2. Heat a cast-iron skillet or flat griddle over high heat until smoking.
3. Place a ball on the griddle, top with a sprinkle of onion, and immediately smash flat with a sturdy spatula. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Cook without moving 2-3 minutes until edges are deeply browned and crispy. Flip, add a slice of cheese, and cook 1 minute more.
5. Toast buns on the griddle. Stack two patties per bun with pickles, ketchup, and mustard.

recipes.name: Grilled Cheese & Tomato Soup
recipes.instructions:
1. For soup: heat olive oil in a pot. Saute onion 5 minutes, add garlic 1 minute. Add tomatoes (crush by hand), salt, and pepper. Simmer 20 minutes.
2. Blend soup until smooth with an immersion blender. Stir in cream and torn basil. Keep warm.
3. For grilled cheese: layer cheddar and Gruyere between sourdough slices.
4. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Cook sandwiches 3-4 minutes per side until deeply golden and cheese is melted.
5. Cut sandwiches in half and serve alongside bowls of soup.

recipes.name: Classic Caesar Salad
recipes.instructions:
1. Toss bread cubes with 2 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt. Toast in a 375F oven 10 minutes until golden croutons.
2. Make dressing: mash anchovies and garlic into a paste. Whisk in egg yolk, lemon juice, mustard, and Worcestershire. Slowly drizzle in remaining olive oil while whisking.
3. Chop romaine into bite-size pieces and place in a large bowl.
4. Toss with dressing, half the Parmesan, and croutons.
5. Serve topped with remaining Parmesan and fresh cracked pepper.

recipes.name: Chicken Quesadillas
recipes.instructions:
1. Toss shredded chicken with cumin, salt, and pepper.
2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Place a tortilla in the pan.
3. Spread cheese over half the tortilla. Top with chicken, poblano, and onion. Fold in half.
4. Cook 2-3 minutes per side until tortilla is golden and cheese is melted. Press gently with a spatula.
5. Cut into wedges and serve with sour cream, guacamole, and salsa.

recipes.name: BLT with Garlic Aioli
recipes.instructions:
1. Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. Drain on paper towels.
2. Make garlic aioli: stir together mayo, minced garlic, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt.
3. Toast sourdough slices until golden.
4. Spread garlic aioli generously on all toast slices.
5. Build sandwiches: lettuce, thick tomato slices seasoned with salt and pepper, 3 slices of crispy bacon.
6. Close sandwiches, slice diagonally, and serve.

recipes.name: French Onion Soup
recipes.instructions:
1. Melt butter with oil in a heavy pot over medium heat. Add onions and a pinch of salt. Cook 40-50 minutes, stirring occasionally, until deep golden brown and caramelized.
2. Deglaze with white wine, scraping up all the fond. Cook until wine evaporates.
3. Add beef broth, thyme, and bay leaf. Simmer 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls. Top each with 2 baguette rounds and a generous mound of Gruyere.
5. Broil 3-4 minutes until cheese is bubbly and golden. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Cobb Salad
recipes.instructions:
1. Whisk vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper. Slowly whisk in olive oil to make a vinaigrette.
2. Spread chopped romaine on a large platter.
3. Slice grilled chicken and arrange in a row across the salad. Arrange rows of bacon, eggs, avocado, tomatoes, and blue cheese.
4. Drizzle vinaigrette over the top just before serving.
5. Toss at the table or serve as-is for presentation.

recipes.name: Tuna Melt
recipes.instructions:
1. Mix tuna, mayo, celery, onion, lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper.
2. Divide tuna mixture among 4 bread slices. Top each with 2 slices of cheddar, then the remaining bread.
3. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook sandwiches 3-4 minutes per side until bread is golden and cheese is melted.
4. Slice in half and serve with pickles or chips.

recipes.name: Cuban Sandwich

ingredients.name: Cuban bread or soft sub rolls

recipes.instructions:
1. Slice rolls lengthwise. Spread mustard generously on both cut sides.
2. Layer Swiss cheese, roasted pork, ham, pickles, and more Swiss cheese.
3. Close sandwiches and butter the outsides.
4. Press in a panini press or a skillet with a heavy pot on top. Cook 4-5 minutes per side until bread is crispy and cheese is melted.
5. Slice diagonally and serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken Tortilla Soup
recipes.instructions:
1. Fry tortilla strips in oil until crispy. Drain on paper towels and salt lightly.
2. Saute onion in a pot with a little oil 5 minutes. Add garlic and cumin, cook 1 minute.
3. Add broth, tomatoes, chipotles, and whole chicken breasts. Simmer 20 minutes until chicken is cooked.
4. Remove chicken, shred with two forks, and return to pot.
5. Ladle into bowls. Top with tortilla strips, avocado, a squeeze of lime, sour cream, and cilantro.

recipes.name: Shrimp Po'Boy
recipes.instructions:
1. Soak shrimp in buttermilk 10 minutes.
2. Mix cornmeal, flour, and Cajun seasoning in a shallow dish.
3. Dredge shrimp in the cornmeal mixture, shaking off excess.
4. Fry in 350F oil for 2-3 minutes until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels.
5. Mix mayo with hot sauce for remoulade.
6. Split rolls, spread remoulade on both sides. Layer lettuce, tomato, and crispy shrimp. Serve with pickles.

recipes.name: Caprese Panini
recipes.instructions:
1. Slice ciabatta rolls in half. Drizzle cut sides with olive oil.
2. Layer fresh mozzarella, tomato slices, and basil leaves on the bottom halves. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and close the sandwiches.
4. Press in a panini press or cook in a skillet with a heavy pan on top. Cook 3-4 minutes per side until bread is crispy and mozzarella begins to melt.
5. Slice in half and serve warm.

recipes.name: Pasta Aglio e Olio
recipes.instructions:
1. Cook spaghetti in well-salted boiling water until 1 minute short of al dente. Reserve 1 cup pasta water.
2. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add sliced garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring, 3-4 minutes until garlic is golden but not burned.
3. Add drained spaghetti to the skillet with 1/2 cup reserved pasta water. Toss vigorously over medium heat, adding more pasta water as needed to create a silky sauce.
4. Remove from heat, toss with parsley, and serve with Parmesan.

recipes.name: Pan-Seared Steak with Herb Butter
recipes.instructions:
1. Season steaks generously with salt and pepper. Let sit at room temperature 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a cast-iron skillet over high heat until smoking.
3. Lay steaks away from you into the pan. Sear 3-4 minutes without moving until a deep brown crust forms. Flip.
4. Add butter, garlic, thyme, and rosemary to the pan. Tilt the pan and baste the steaks with the herb butter for 2-3 minutes.
5. Cook to desired doneness (130F internal for medium-rare). Rest 5-10 minutes before slicing.

recipes.name: Chicken Parmesan
recipes.instructions:
1. Pound chicken breasts to even 1/2 inch thickness. Season with salt and pepper.
2. Set up breading station: flour, beaten eggs, panko mixed with half the Parmesan.
3. Dredge chicken in flour, dip in egg, press into panko mixture.
4. Pan-fry in olive oil over medium-high heat 3-4 minutes per side until golden. Transfer to a baking sheet.
5. Spoon marinara over each cutlet, top with mozzarella and remaining Parmesan.
6. Bake at 425F for 15 minutes until cheese is bubbly and golden.
7. Serve over spaghetti with fresh basil.

recipes.name: Beef Stew
recipes.instructions:
1. Toss beef cubes in flour, salt, and pepper.
2. Heat oil in a Dutch oven over high heat. Brown beef in batches on all sides, about 3 minutes per batch. Remove and set aside.
3. Reduce heat to medium. Saute onion 5 minutes, add garlic and tomato paste, cook 1 minute.
4. Deglaze with red wine, scraping up the fond. Simmer until reduced by half.
5. Return beef to pot. Add broth, thyme, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then cover and cook in a 325F oven for 1 hour.
6. Add potatoes and carrots. Return to oven for 1 more hour until beef is fork-tender.
7. Discard thyme and bay leaves. Adjust seasoning and serve.

recipes.name: Garlic Butter Salmon
recipes.instructions:
1. Pat salmon dry and season generously with salt and pepper.
2. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place salmon skin-side up and sear 4 minutes until a golden crust forms.
3. Flip salmon. Add butter, garlic, and lemon juice to the pan.
4. Baste salmon with the garlic butter for 3-4 minutes until cooked to medium (135F internal).
5. Remove from heat, spoon pan sauce over each fillet, and garnish with fresh dill.

recipes.name: Chicken Marsala
recipes.instructions:
1. Pound chicken cutlets to 1/4 inch thickness. Season with salt and pepper, dredge in flour.
2. Heat olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken 3 minutes per side until golden. Remove to a plate.
3. Add remaining butter and mushrooms to the skillet. Cook 5 minutes until browned. Add shallot, cook 1 minute.
4. Pour in Marsala wine and scrape up any browned bits. Simmer 3 minutes until reduced by half.
5. Add broth and cream. Simmer 5 minutes until sauce thickens.
6. Return chicken to the pan, spoon sauce over, and cook 2 minutes. Garnish with thyme.

recipes.name: Homemade Pizza Margherita
recipes.instructions:
1. Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let sit 5 minutes until foamy. Mix with flour, oil, and salt. Knead 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
2. Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover, and let rise 1 hour until doubled.
3. Preheat oven to 500F (or as hot as it goes) with a pizza stone or inverted baking sheet.
4. Divide dough into 4 portions. Stretch each into a thin round on a floured surface.
5. Spoon crushed tomatoes over each round (don't overdo it). Season with salt.
6. Slide onto the hot stone and bake 8-10 minutes until crust is puffed and charred in spots.
7. Remove, top with torn mozzarella and fresh basil. Drizzle with olive oil. The residual heat melts the cheese perfectly.

recipes.name: Beef Tacos
recipes.instructions:
1. Season ground beef with chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and salt.
2. Cook in a skillet over medium-high heat, breaking into small crumbles, until well-browned and slightly crispy, about 8-10 minutes. Drain excess fat.
3. Warm corn tortillas on a dry skillet or directly over a gas flame until pliable and slightly charred.
4. Double up tortillas for each taco. Fill with seasoned beef.
5. Top with diced onion, cilantro, a squeeze of lime, and salsa verde. Serve with sliced radishes on the side.

recipes.name: Shrimp Scampi
recipes.instructions:
1. Cook linguine in salted water until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain.
2. Heat olive oil and 2 tbsp butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season shrimp with salt and pepper, cook 2 minutes per side until pink. Remove.
3. Add garlic and red pepper flakes to the pan, cook 30 seconds. Pour in wine and lemon juice, simmer 2 minutes.
4. Add remaining butter, return shrimp, and toss in the linguine. Add pasta water as needed for a silky sauce.
5. Toss with parsley and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Braised Short Ribs
recipes.instructions:
1. Season short ribs generously with salt and pepper.
2. Heat oil in a heavy Dutch oven over high heat. Sear ribs on all sides until deeply browned, about 3 minutes per side. Remove.
3. Reduce heat to medium. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook 8 minutes until softened and lightly browned.
4. Add garlic and tomato paste, cook 2 minutes. Pour in red wine and bring to a boil, scraping up fond. Reduce by half.
5. Return ribs to the pot. Add broth, thyme, and bay leaves. Liquid should come 3/4 up the ribs.
6. Cover and braise in a 325F oven for 2.5-3 hours until meat is fall-off-the-bone tender.
7. Strain braising liquid, skim fat, and reduce to a glossy sauce. Serve ribs with the sauce over mashed potatoes or polenta.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.instructions:
1. Marinate chicken in yogurt, half the garam masala, turmeric, cumin, and chili powder for at least 30 minutes (or overnight).
2. Broil marinated chicken on a sheet pan 4-5 minutes per side until charred. Cut into bite-size pieces.
3. Melt butter in a large pan. Saute onion 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger, cook 1 minute.
4. Add remaining garam masala, cook 30 seconds. Add crushed tomatoes and simmer 15 minutes.
5. Stir in cream and the chicken pieces. Simmer 5 minutes until sauce is rich and thick.
6. Garnish with cilantro. Serve over basmati rice with warm naan.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat oil and butter in a heavy pot. Cook pancetta 3 minutes. Add onion, carrot, and celery. Cook 5 minutes until softened.
2. Add ground beef and pork. Cook, breaking up, until no longer pink.
3. Pour in milk and simmer, stirring occasionally, until it has almost completely evaporated.
4. Add nutmeg, then wine. Simmer until wine evaporates.
5. Add tomatoes (crushed by hand) and a pinch of salt. Bring to a gentle simmer.
6. Cook uncovered at the barest simmer for 2 hours, stirring occasionally. The sauce should be rich and thick.
7. Toss with cooked spaghetti and serve with grated Parmesan.
